_emerg_resp.CoordinatingAgencyName: Chester Cty Dept. of Emergency Svc

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A Risk Management Plan has been implemented at the Parkesburg, Pennsylvania facility for the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous materials. The facility is operated by A. Duie Pyle Inc., and located at 100 South Limestone Road, Parkesburg, (Chester County) Pennsylvania. The facility is a storage and distribution warehouse that houses consumer products packaged in aerosol cans for The Scotts Company, LLC, which is headquartered in Marysville, Ohio.  Based on the materials and the processes and results of the offsite consequence analysis discussed below, this plan meets the requirements of Program 1.



The aerosol cans are manufactured by S.C. Johnson & Son, and consist of consumer product brands Off and Raid.  Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) propellant used in the aerosol products contains several components that are classified as flammable materials under EPA's RMP regulations.  Specifically, the propellants consist of propane, butane and isobutane blends.  The maximum potential quantities of aerosol products containing these substances were conservatively based on the maximum storage capacity (approximately 2,000 pallets) of the cage areas at the facility dedicated to storage of aerosol products.  The maximum product propellant weights were used to estimate the maximum potential inventories of RMP-regulated chemicals in the warehouse storage process.  Although the actual amounts in the warehouse at any given time should be much lower, the estimated maximum potential amount of each substance is: 



?    Butane:    594,594 lbs

?    Isobutane:    201,637 lbs

?    Propane:     411,880 lbs



A worst case scenario was performed using the EPA's Offsite Consequence Analysis Guidance and provided software (RMP*Comp) for a vessel with the greatest amount of propellant mixture.  The maximum quantity of each substance in a single vessel is: 0.39 lbs butane, 0.13 lbs of isobutane, and 0.13 lbs of propane.  The software predicts that the maximum distance to the 1 psi overpressure en

dpoint for this mixture will not extend beyond facility property.  The calculated radius of impact for the mixture is 37 feet.  Note that the RMP*eSubmit program requires that the quantity of each substance be rounded to the nearest pound (1 lbs), and that the impact radius be reported to two significant digits in miles (0.01 mi).  



No offsite receptors would be impacted under either scenario.  When not being handled for shipment, all aerosols are stored on pallets within dedicated aerosol cages equipped with additional sprinkler protection.  There have been no prior accidents at the facility associated with this process.



This process is being incorporated into the facility's emergency response/contingency plan which is provided to and coordinated with the following: Chester County PA LEPC, Parkesburg Borough Municipal Government, Parkesburg Fire Company, Parkesburg Borough Police Department, Octorara School District, Parkesburg Borough Emergency Management Coordinator, PEMA, Chester County Department of Emergency Services, and the Chester County Health Department.  The emergency response plans are reviewed biannually and updated as needed, and employees are also provided emergency response/preparedness training on an annual basis.
